item.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR 12/18/2007 S15936-15939; text as passed Senate: CR 12/18/2007 S15936; text of measure as introduced: CR 12/18/2007 S15922)

Passed/agreed to in Senate: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR 12/18/2007 S15936-15939; text as passed Senate: CR 12/18/2007 S15936; text of measure as introduced: CR 12/18/2007 S15922)

summary.text: Recognizes the 50th running of the Daytona 500 on February 17, 2008, and designates that date as Race Day in America.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Recognizes the 50th running of the Daytona 500 on February 17, 2008, and designates that date as Race Day in America.

bill.title: A resolution designating February 17, 2008, as "Race Day in America" and highlighting the 50th running of the Daytona 500.

item.title: A resolution designating February 17, 2008, as "Race Day in America" and highlighting the 50th running of the Daytona 500.
A resolution designating February 17, 2008, as "Race Day in America" and highlighting the 50th running of the Daytona 500.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
